publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-6623 Willie Coffey: Congratulations to the Winners of the Scottish Education Awards—That the Parliament congratulates the11 schools and four individuals recognised for their innovative work and outstanding achievements at the 2010 Scottish Education Awards, including Grange Academy, Kilmarnock,winner ofthe awardin the category of Entrepreneurial Learning; notes that the winners faced stiff competition with more than 650 nominations received from all across Scotland, andacknowledges the support of the Daily Record, as joint promoter along with the Scottish Government, and sponsors Caledonia Play, CBI Scotland, Determined to Succeed, Glasgow City Council, Learning and Teaching Scotland, Northern Books, Quality Meat Scotland and the Scottish Qualifications Authority.
S3M-6623 Congratulations to the Winners of the Scottish Education Awards (lodged on 21 June 2010) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-6623 Willie Coffey: Congratulations to the Winners of the Scottish Education Awards—That the Parliament congratulates the 11 schools and four individuals recognised for their innovative work and outstanding achievements at the 2010 Scottish Education Awards, including Grange Academy, Kilmarnock, winner of the award in the category of Entrepreneurial Learning; notes that the winners faced stiff competition with more than 650 nominations received from all across Scotland, and acknowledges the support of the Daily Record, as joint promoter along with the Scottish Government, and sponsors Caledonia Play, CBI Scotland, Determined to Succeed, Glasgow City Council, Learning and Teaching Scotland, Northern Books, Quality Meat Scotland and the Scottish Qualifications Authority. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Michael Matheson*
